hackathon-rules: *This is the most important aspect in the judging criteria and will make up most of the overall score.*

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize Pool: (Each Team Member Can Pick 1 of the Following) Beats Solo Headphones, Pebble Time Smartwatches, 32" Smart TV
Prize Pool: (Each Team Member Can Pick 1 of the Following) Beats Solo Headphones, Pebble Time Smartwatches, 32" Smart TV
Prize Pool: (Each Team Member Can Pick 1 of the Following) Beats Solo Headphones, Pebble Time Smartwatches, 32" Smart TV
$50 Amazon Giftcards to each winning member
DSLR Cameras and Clarifai Sponsored Skateboards
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Clarifai API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Echo to each member of the winning team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Hack Sponsored by Rockwell Collins

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Fire Tablet to each member of the winning team, $10 Amazon Giftcard
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Mobile App Sponsored by ERAU MAD Club

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Willie Miller Instructional Center, 600 S Clyde Morris Blvd, Daytona Beach, FL 32114, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: “Is this project technically difficult?  Was it something that was easy to build or was simply an add on to something that is already out there?  Were there real challenges to surmount in the 24 hours to make this product work?”

“Is this solution to a problem something that has been seen millions of times before?  Is the idea unique and creative?  Is it a new solution to an old problem or something novel, advanced, and never before seen?”
“Is the hack usable in its current state?  Does everything appear to work?  How is the overall User Interface of the project?  Is the project easy for the user to navigate and understand?”

“Is the hack practical?  Is it something that people could actually use?  Does it solve a real world problem?  What kind of audience is it geared towards?  Does it help solve a problem for a social good?  What kind of social impact does it have?”

hackathon-location-address: Willie Miller Instructional Center, 600 S Clyde Morris Blvd, Daytona Beach, FL 32114, USA
hackathon-description-header: Build awesome stuff in 24 hours with a focus on aviation and airplanes!
